title.narrative: Output 2.4: Children and their families access timely sufficient and safe WASH services in humanitarian situations

description.narrative: Nationally, UNICEF's WASH in emergency response reached 980,679 people, including 894,253 affected persons in the conflict-affected Borno, Yobe and Adamawa (BAY) states, with life-saving water, sanitation and hygiene services with. | Status:On-track | As-of Date:31/12/2019

title.narrative: Percentage of UNICEF-targeted people in humanitarian situations who access timely, gender-sensitive safe drinking water, basic sanitation and hygiene services

Existence of Child sensitive national or local risk management plans addressing risks related to disasters, climate change, conflict, public health emergencies or other crises.
